Fields.DialogueText: Well, look at that, Kanchou, you're doing a lot better than I expected.
I have to say, it's a lot harder than it looks, but I'm starting to see why you're always doing these exercises.
That's the kind of talk I like to hear. Keep that up and you'll be in better shape than me.

Fields.MenuText: I doubt that.
I know you're joking, but you never know.
Really? You think so?

Fields.DialogueText: ... You'll be in better shape than any other human on the ship?
Maybe a little, but I do think you have a lot of potential, Kanchou.
... Let's see you do a few more exercises before I comment any further.
You know, I think it might be time to take a break. I'm starting to feel lightheaded.
Oh, you'll get used to that before long.
Wait, you mean you always feel like this?
Sure, after I've tumbled my way through the halls. I hardly notice it anymore.
I don't like it.
You have to fight through it, Kanchou!
*ALARM*
Oh, look at that. What horrible timing.
I heard that, Kanchou. We'll get back to this later.
@BATTLE
Kanchou, we need to change our heading!
What? What's going on?
We're getting a request for aid from a foreign civilian ship. They're under heavy attack from a group of Funayūrei.

Fields.MenuText: So?
Then we need to hurry and help them.
How big is the group? Coming to someone's aid won't do us or them any good if we're overpowered as well.

Fields.DialogueText: So?! They might be out of our way, but as an INPF ship, it's our duty to help civilians.
Precisely my thinking. I'm glad we're on the same page.
I've no doubt we're up to this task, Kanchou.
How far off course will this take us?
Not far, I promise. We'll be back on course in no time.
I suppose that's one of the perks of you being one of the fastest ships in the fleet.
One of?
You're right, you're right. You're the fastest ship. Ever.
That's more like it.
@BATTLE
Is that Ikazuchi? What's she doing over there?
*murmurmurmur*
Ikazuchi? Are you all right?
Hmmm, oh! Kanchou! I didn't notice you there.
My apologies, I didn't mean to sneak up on you. What are you doing?
After battle, I like to pray for the fallen.
For the Morganas?
They may be our enemies, but Funayūrei deserve peace as much as anyone else.
That's quite... magnanimous of you, Ikazuchi.
Was there something you needed, Kanchou?
I wanted to let you know that the ship we rescued... well, they were very grateful.
I'm just glad we were able to help.
They also wanted us to know that the Morganas we fought off were only a small offshoot of the ones who attacked them initially. The ship's captain called them a horde.
A horde of Funayūrei? No one else in the area has mentioned anything like that, have they?

Fields.MenuText: It could be a recently formed alliance...
I haven't the slightest. But at least we know now.
Communications in the area isn't without fault. Plenty of useful information falls through the cracks.

Fields.DialogueText: Recent? More like an overnight alliance.
You're right. And now that we know, we can do something about it.
Well, that's reassuring.
We need to find this horde, Kanchou.
I agree. I've already changed our heading.
*ALARM*
Not soon enough.
Either you're getting slower, or the Morganas are getting faster.
Nonsense. I think you just spent too long chatting with the other ship's captain.
@BATTLE
So that's the "horde"? It's not the armada I was expecting.
Are you joking? That's... a sizeable group. You think we can take them all on our own?
I could speed circles around them. Not one of them would touch me.

Fields.MenuText: Knowing you, I don't doubt that.
You really think you're that untouchable?
There are some odds that even you can't take on.

Fields.DialogueText: You've seen what I can do. This is nothing for me.
You disagree?
Maybe, but I think I can handle this. They'll need to bolster their numbers a little more before I'm worried.
So what do you think we should do?
Hurry in and blow this horde apart before it can cause any more trouble.
That's your plan?
You didn't ask for a plan. You asked what we should do. We don't need a plan to take care of a ragtag group like this. Come on, trust me.
Your confidence is hard to argue with.
So I've been told.
Let's rush in. We have a horde to destroy.
@BATTLE
You seem pretty touchable to me.
Hey! Hey, quit it. Quit poking me, Kanchou!
Ikazuchi...
Kanchou, I know the situation is looking a little dire, but I promise I have everything under control.
They're surrounding us.
There might be a few more Funayūrei than I expected, but I can keep avoiding their hits and swooping in before they have time to respond.
Ikazuchi, didn't you hear me? We're surrounded on all sides. It's going to be difficult to move around when they're closing in on us.
What?! When did that happen?
Are you kidding me? Listen, we have to force an opening and avoid the center of their strength.
No, I'm telling you, Kanchou. I can still defeat each and every one of them.
I'm not risking it. Not with these numbers.
@BATTLE
I had everything under control, Kanchou!

Fields.MenuText: You didn't even realize we were surrounded.
I'm sure you did. I just didn't want to take the chance.
It's too late. We've already fought through.

Fields.DialogueText: I would've. And I could've handled it.
I thought you trusted me! I can handle a few Funayūrei.
We can turn back. I can still finish the rest of them.
Ikazuchi, we're running dangerously low on supplies. At the very least, we have to restock before we dive back into that horde.
I... I guess I can understand that.
Thank you.
I'll be in my room.
Ikazuchi, we've hit port. Wait, what's that you're eating?
It's manju. You have me too worked up to even be embarrassed about it.
What happened to not consuming anything bad for you? No junk food, no smoking, no drinking. That's all I've heard from you since I met you.
Sometimes I deviate ever so slightly from my diet and eat a manju or two. Usually when I'm stressed or angry.

Fields.MenuText: One or two? How many are you holding right now?
Is this your way of saying you're angry with me?
I understand that. Everyone needs a break now and then.

Fields.DialogueText: Three. Got a problem with that?
No. This is. I'm angry with you.
I don't need a break. I... I just want a break.
Mind if I have some?
Fine. I'm still mad at you, though.
You shouldn't be. I'm still-- mmmm, these are good. I could eat a dozen of them.
I already have.
Good Lord.
Was there a reason you wanted to see me?
As soon as we're finished at port, we'll be turning around to take on that horde again.
What? Really? You're not just saying that to cheer me up?
No, I'm serious. I don't doubt our ability to take on that horde. I think we just need to prepare a little more before we face them. Make sure we're properly stocked, and all that.
This is fantastic! I guess I didn't need to eat those twenty-three manju after all! I swear, Kanchou, you're not going to regret this!
*ALARM*
Looks like you cheered up just in time.
Leave the Funayūrei to me. I'm fueled by manju and happiness!
There she goes, flipping away. I guess a sweet tooth might explain all her energy.
@BATTLE
That's the horde there. It didn't take long to track them down.
Hordes of any type are generally pretty noticeable. Though, I think it does look smaller than it did the first time we faced them.
I told you I could handle them.

Fields.MenuText: Prove it.
I never doubted it.
You keep saying that. Do you think I'm deaf?

Fields.DialogueText: Fine, I will. Just sit back and watch.
You say that now, but you still made us retreat.
I'm just making sure you know. I can handle anything. I'm the fastest ship in the fleet.
Now that we're properly supplied, can we rush in and finish these Funayūrei once and for all? They've already caused enough havoc.
They won't know what hit them.
That's what I like to hear.
@BATTLE
There's still more of them.
I hope you're not thinking of avoiding them.
As long as you're not.
I wouldn't dream of it.
@BATTLE
That was an honorable battle.
More than honorable. It could've gone either way.
You really think that? I was in control from the moment the first shot was fired.

Fields.MenuText: The Morganas did have difficulty keeping up with you.
You had some luck on your side, Ikazuchi, whether you admit it or not.
Confidence is still a great color on you, Ikazuchi. Looking good.

Fields.DialogueText: They didn't stand a chance.
Luck? Try skill. I've worked for every victory I've earned. That one especially.
What, I... Don't try to distract me with compliments!
We're low on supplies again. We should probably hurry to port before any other Morganas decide to show up.
Sounds like it's time to make a speedy exit. I'm your Belle.
Kanchou, I added a little something to the supply list for us. Think you can make sure we get plenty of it?
What is-- oh, manju, huh? I think I can manage to supply your habit, as long as you share a few with me.
I said us, didn't I? We can be snack buddies now.

Fields.MenuText: I like the sound of that.
Buddies?
Don't hog all the good ones for yourself.

Fields.DialogueText: Me, too. It can be our little secret.
Not just buddies. Snack buddies. Although we can workshop the name if you think it needs improvement.
One, I'm not a some kind of swine. Two, they're all good, so there's no need to worry.
All right, now go out and get us some manju.
The crew is more than capable of tracking down manju with the rest of the supplies we need.
But that would mean exposing my snacking habits. That's not going to happen.
There's nothing wrong with snacking occasionally, Ikazuchi.
I disagree. Please, just do it yourself.
All right, I'll find them. It shouldn't take too long.
*ALARM*
Although it might take a little longer than I anticipated.
I'm not letting Funayūrei keep me from my treats!
@BATTLE
Heh, snack buddies is fine.
*SLAM*
What the hell was that?
Oooooh, ooooow...
Ikazuchi? What were you doing out there?
I slammed my head into your door...
Why? Why did you do that?
I didn't mean to...

Fields.MenuText: Maybe you should think about padding yourself before practicing...
Are you okay? Do you need some ice for your head, Ikazuchi?
You're a Belle, so couldn't you have phased through the door?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm an expert. I don't need padding.
I'll be fine. I've hit my head harder than that.
I'll have to keep that in mind for the next time.
You know, I think it might be a good idea if you kept the gymnastics confined to a specified area.
You know, I've had the same thought. But nah, I'll be fine. See you later, Kanchou!
Flipping right by the door she slammed her head into seconds earlier. She's pretty hard-headed.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Kanchou, did you hear?!

Fields.MenuText: About the port under attack?
About the toilet overflow in the men's head?

Fields.DialogueText: That's exactly what I'm talking about.
What? Ew, no! There's a port under attack.
You really should pay better attention, Kanchou. There's a port under attack.
We're a fair distance away from them, but no other INPF ship is closer than we are. We need to come to their aid.
Well, it's a good thing you're as fast as you are. The port might actually stand a chance.
What are you... You don't usually compliment me like this.
I'm just speaking the truth.
Is that a fact? Well, just wait until after the battle! I'll be able to give you a whole host of things to compliment me on between now and then.
@BATTLE
Morganas dead ahead!
@BATTLE
Praying again?
I was just about to start.
I guess I have good timing, then.
Kanchou, you look like you have something you want to ask me.

Fields.MenuText: Do you really think praying for Morganas is going to do any good?
It must be strange... praying for Morganas.
No, no. I'm fine.

Fields.DialogueText: That's not why I do it. It's a form of respect. I respect my enemies. Especially the mighty ones.
Not for me. It's just my way to show respect to my foes after a battle.
Very well. You know, if you'd ever like to join me in my prayers, you'd be more than welcome.
Well, I'll let you get to it. I have my own way of showing respect for the Morganas.
Paperwork and reports?
You guessed it.
I appreciate the offer. I'll keep that in mind.
Enemy patrol sighted!
@BATTLE
Ikazuchi, you'd best prepare yourself. The manju has arrived!
Hm? Oh, good.
That's not exactly the reaction I wanted. What's going on?
On the horizon. See that dark mass? The horde is back.
Well, would you look at that? Looks as if we didn't leave a strong enough impression on them the first time.
I think they've grown in size since the last time we faced them.

Fields.MenuText: We should take them head-on again.
What do you think we should do?
Maybe someone else should have a go at them.

Fields.DialogueText: No, there must be a smarter way to deal with them.
We need to come up with a plan. There are too many to take on at once...
Someone else? No, this is our battle, Kanchou. You understand that, don't you?
Once everyone returns to the ship, we'll make our way to the horde.
And on the way, we can put our heads together. We'll come up with some kind of a plan.
Arigatō, Kanchou. I appreciate the helping hand.
All right, where are they, Kanchou?
Where are what?
I know you have the manju, Kanchou! An officer saw you sneak a box into your quarters while they were passing by. How could you do something so terrible!?

Fields.MenuText: The crew is a bunch of liars. And I should know. I'm their captain.
Okay, I'll admit it. I took them.
Manju? That's that... ammunition we use with that new gun, right?

Fields.DialogueText: Which would make you the king of liars. Untrustworthy. Conniving...
Good. Now give them to me.
Don't play stupid with me. We both know what I'm talking about.
It's all right, Ikazuchi, I took the manju for you. Well, for us.
What are you talking about?
I didn't want the crew to see the manju and start asking questions. I've been keeping our snacking habits a secret, like you wanted.
Oh! Well, I guess that makes sense. You weren't hiding them from me, you were hiding them from the crew.
I figured that would be best.
We do need to look out for one another. We're snack buddies, after all.
*ALARM*
Exactly, but that'll have to wait. We have company.
But, but... manju.
We'll celebrate with it after.
Fine. Then we'd better make this quick.
@BATTLE
So that's the plan. It should work if we're careful enough. Understand?

Fields.MenuText: I'm sorry, were you talking this whole time? I wasn't paying attention.
It should work, but let's go over it one more time.
We've got this. That horde is as good as gone.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, shut up. I know you were paying attention. But let's go over it one more time, just to be safe.
Just to be safe? Smart thinking.
Don't get so cocky, Kanchou. Let's go over it one more time.
We'll swoop in, draw some attention with a few shots, then make a speedy retreat. Hopefully, we'll lure a fraction of the force away with us.
A small fraction.
But not too small.
We don't want the majority of them chasing us.
You don't think we could handle that?
Do you?
I'd rather not have to fight such a massive force again, but I think I'd come out on top.
*ALARM*
Just like this next fight.
@BATTLE
All right, we're approaching the Funayūrei, Kanchou.
It looks like the horde's gotten even bigger.
Are you nervous?

Fields.MenuText: Of course I am!
Not even one bit.
Are you?

Fields.DialogueText: Well, at least you're honest about it.
Hmmm, me neither. We just need to stick to the plan.
That was avoiding the question, Kanchou. But no, I'm plenty confident our plan will work.
Ikazuchi, Captain, we're stepping foot into firing range.
You hear that? It's about to begin.
Let's pull the trigger and see how many we can reel in.
Sounds like a plan. Fire!
Yes, ma'am.
*BOOM*
The Morganas are looking our way.
Let's get out of here and bring some of them with us.
Double time!
@BATTLE
Well, that went according to plan.
Better than planned, actually. We lured away a larger portion of the group than I was expecting.
Really? I'm glad the entire plan didn't end up blowing up in our faces.
Wait, Kanchou. Look. The remainder of the horde is moving.
I think that's what hordes do.
No, they've been moving in a pattern this entire time. Now they're deviating!
Oh... I see why. Look at that convoy to the west.
Even with reduced numbers... those Funayūrei could lay waste to those ships.
You're not wrong.
We have to help.

Fields.MenuText: Uh, no, we don't.
You're right. Let's step in.
We have a plan, Ikazuchi.

Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou, they'll be consumed by those Funayūrei if we do nothing.
I knew you'd see things my way. Arigatō, Kanchou.
Plans change. Especially when lives and ships are in danger.
Do I have permission to change our heading?
Yes. Do it.
She's a force of nature when she sets her mind to something. Who would even try to argue with her?
@BATTLE
The convoy was able to escape, Kanchou, but...
We have the entire horde breathing down our neck now, don't we?
Exactly.
This feels familiar.
Maybe a little. Only this time, there are twice as many Funayūrei. We don't stand a chance.
Hmmm...
Do you have a plan?
If we steer toward those shoals there, we might stand a better chance.
We would have to be careful not to run aground, but some of the horde will almost certainly turn back rather than risk their ships.
Captain, the Morganas are approaching. Do we have a plan?
What do you think, Ikazuchi?
Let's do it.
We best be on our way, then.
We don't have a moment to waste.
@BATTLE
Let's whittle down this horde!
@BATTLE
Praying again?
We're lucky to be alive and afloat, Kanchou. Those Funayūrei earned our respect.

Fields.MenuText: Hmmm... you're not wrong.
You're right. Maybe I'll join you.
We deserve respect after defeating a horde of that size.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm glad you see it that way. Would you like to join me?
Please do. There's always room at my side.
We're given plenty of respect without giving it to ourselves.
Please, Kanchou, just sit here for a moment and collect your thoughts. Think about our battle and appreciate the enemy's tactics and strength.
That's all there is to these prayers of yours?
Hai. That's it.
Well, if you insist.
Shhh.
You know, I think I like this. The quiet. Spending time with you.
Kanchou?
Oh, right. "Shhh."
Are you sure this plan will still work, Ikazuchi?
Why wouldn't it?
Well, they might have figured out our plan after our last encounter with them.
You really think Funayūrei are that intelligent?

Fields.MenuText: You're the one who's always going on about respecting our enemies.
I've certainly encountered Morganas I'd consider clever.
No, but there's always a chance.

Fields.DialogueText: I respect their combat prowess. But I'm not going to ask them to handle complex math equations any time soon.
Clever or not, I like our odds.
I'd need more than a chance possibility to change my plans.
*ALARM*
The alarm? We haven't even fired yet!
*BOOM*
No, but they're firing on us!
What? Are we even in range?
No, but they're coming our way anyway.
Let's get out of here. We wanted to get their attention, and we certainly did that.
You're right. Let's move!
@BATTLE
Kanchou, whoa! Kanchou, are you okay?
Too... much... manju...
How many did you eat?
I stopped counting... a while ago. Ghhgh.
Do you need something? Are you going to throw up?
It's okay, I...  I think I'll be okay. Urp. I think.
The art of eating manju is a delicate thing. You were clearly not prepared.

Fields.MenuText: What do you know? I'll eat what I want!
You're right about that... I'll leave the manju to you.
But it's so good!

Fields.DialogueText: That's the manju talking. I forgive you, Kanchou.
Now, now, don't give up on manju entirely, Kanchou.
It truly is. But I shouldn't have to tell you that too much of a good thing can be a bad thing.
*ALARM*
Oh, good grief. The Morganas have the worst timing. Gheurp.
Don't go throwing up now! What would the crew think? You'll have to hold it until after the battle.
I can do this... Urp. I can do this.
Come on. It's okay, don't think about it. Just focus on the fight.
@BATTLE
Ikazuchi, you're eyeing the horde again?
It's really not large enough to be called a horde anymore. It's more of a group now.
True enough. A smattering, if you will.
I think it's time we show them we're not to be trifled with. What do you think, Kanchou?

Fields.MenuText: The sooner the better, if you ask me.
You're sure about that?
Seems scary.

Fields.DialogueText: Then we shouldn't waste any time.
Well, if we tried to draw them out again, we'd probably lure them all to us.
Aw... My little baby kanchou. Don't worry - you have me. I'll protect you.
If you're sure about this, we should make certain we're properly supplied.
That's an excellent idea, Kanchou.
*ALARM*
Though first, we have a few stray Morganas to fend off.
What else is new?
@BATTLE
This is it, Kanchou. No turning back after we rush in there.

Fields.MenuText: Why would we want to turn back? As long as there are Morganas to gun down in front of us, it's full speed ahead.
You know, this is more nerve-wracking than I expected!
Do you think we're ready?

Fields.DialogueText: Heh, I like your enthusiasm. Let's just make sure we're not gunned down in the process.
Calm down, Kanchou. You have nothing to worry about. We've prepared for this.
I think we're as ready as we can be. And that's all we can ask for.
That's the leader there, Kanchou. If we take her down, the rest should be a piece of cake.
You know, she's smaller than I was expecting.
But she's fast. Not as fast as I am, but nothing is.
Then let's prove it. We'll show those Morganas what you're made of.
Excellent idea, Kanchou. You've got my confidence up! Let's get going!
@BATTLE
Ikazuchi, the battle has been won. Why are we still lingering here?
One more moment, Kanchou. I'm sure there's something we're not seeing.
But what are you looking for?
I don't know. But I'll know it when I see it.

Fields.MenuText: Okay, take all the time you need.
We need to make it back to port. We shouldn't waste time out here just because you might spot something.
Are you maybe looking for Morgana parts? Because I'm seeing a lot of those.

Fields.DialogueText: Arigatō, Kanchou. I'll try not to be much longer.
I know, I'm sorry. I just have this sinking feeling in my stomach. I can't help it.
No, not just parts. I'm looking for something special.
You have to admit. There was something odd about that Funayūrei behavior.
Can we really call anything Morganas do "normal"?
Hmmm...  No, I know what I saw. There must be something we're missing.
*ALARM*
Great, more of them?
I'm sorry, Kanchou. I guess I took too long.
Don't worry, Ikazuchi. it's not your fault that these Morganas can't see they're starting a fight they can't win.
I think some of my confidence is rubbing off on you.
@BATTLE
Kanchou, are you ready to celebrate our victory?

Fields.MenuText: I'm always up for a party!
That depends on what you have planned.
What's the catch?

Fields.DialogueText: I wasn't exactly thinking a party, Kanchou. I had something else in mind.
Well, I could tell you, but I'd rather it be a surprise.
No, no catch. I just made you something to commemorate our victory.
Tell me what you have planned, Ikazuchi.
All right, here it is. I made some manju myself, from scratch. I wanted to share it with you.
Ghghghghghhh.
Kanchou, are you okay? Your face is turning green.
I'm fine, but I think I'm a little scarred from my last manju experience.
Oh, does that mean you don't want any?
You made them for me from scratch. How could I turn that down?
You don't have to force yourself to eat them for me.
I want to, Ikazuchi. You went to the effort of making them for me. It's the least I can do.
Well, I'll let you enjoy them, then. I should get back to my post anyway.
No, stay, we can eat them together.
You want me to?
Of course. I... I enjoy your company.
I enjoy your company too, Kanchou. Maybe I haven't really told you so, but here... *kiss* That might tell you something.
*ALARM*
Will those Funayūrei ever leave us alone?
With my luck, not likely.
@BATTLE
